item.title: Tiffany add a quote by Francis Bacon
item.description: "Read not to contradict and confute; nor to believe and take for granted; nor to find talk and discourse; but to weigh and consider. Some books are to be tasted, others to be swallowed, and some few to be chewed and digested: that is, some books are to be read only in parts, others to be read, but not curiously, and some few to be read wholly, and with diligence and attention." -- Francis Bacon

item.title: Tiffany add a quote by Gye Fram
item.description: "The forest is magnificent, yet it contains no perfect trees." -- Gye Fram

item.title: Tiffany add a quote by Rita Mae Brown
item.description: "Unfortunately, Susan didn't remember what Jane Fulton once said, 'Insanity is doing the same thing, over and over again, but expecting different results." -- Rita Mae Brown
